title: Rewrite the Function in Standard Form
text: The standard cotangent function is $$f(x)=\operatorname{Acot}\left(Bx-C\right)+D$$. Rewrite the given function to match this form: $$f(x)=5\left(\operatorname{cot}\left(x+\frac{\pi}{2}\right)-3\right)=5\operatorname{cot}\left(x+\frac{\pi}{2}\right)-15$$

title: Find the Period
text: For the standard cotangent function $$f(x)=\operatorname{Acot}\left(Bx-C\right)+D$$, the period is $$\frac{\pi}{|B|}$$. So $$T=\frac{\pi}{1}=pi$$.

title: Find the Horizontal Shift
text: For the standard cotangent function $$f(x)=\operatorname{Acot}\left(Bx-C\right)+D$$, the phase shift is $$\frac{C}{B}$$. So $$h=\frac{\left(-\frac{\pi}{2}\right)}{1}=\frac{-\pi}{2}$$

title: Find the Vertical Shift
text: For the standard cotangent function $$f(x)=\operatorname{Acot}\left(Bx-C\right)+D$$, the vertical shift is D. So vertical shift is $$-15$$.
